debconf has low, medium, high and critical flags, they determine the level of questions asked
debconf? i'm new to linux ... what is this?
its a tool used by packages for asking questions about how you want your package configured.
during the initial install, debconf is set to high(critical) so very few questions are asked; when you do dpkg-reconfigure on the command line it defaults to low, so 'every' question is asked
of ubuntu, when you boot from the cd & install
ok, so debconf sets how many questions a user is confrunted with during an installation
no, it's a debian/ubuntu thing. I assume other debian based distros use it also
you would be telling the router to forward inbound port 80 traffic specifically to the ubuntu computer; no other machine would recieve that traffic
